text:
Licence to Thrill: Judi Dench destroys competition – voted the UK's Best Bond Girl EVER Licence to Thrill: Judi Dench destroys competition – voted the UK's Best Bond Girl EVER JUDI DENCH has thrashed the likes of Eva Green, Halle Berry, Ursula Andress, Honor Blackman and Gemma Arterton to be voted the UK's favourite Bond Girl of all time as SPECTRE hits cinemas. PLUS the nations reveals its favourite James Bond actor and Bond villain. PUBLISHED: 13:35, Thu, Oct 22, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:22, Thu, Oct 22, 2015 GETTY Judi Dench and Daniel Craig were the perfect James Bond pairing 
Bond girls are famous for their enviable assets, and their inability to resists the charms of 007. 
All except one. 
Judi Dench has swept a new UK poll to find the nation's favourite Bond girl. 
From Daniel Craig's heroic Bond to Javier Bardem's terrifying villain, she has mesmerised the lot of us with her steely resolve – and that fabulous, filthy cackle. GETTY Judi Dench, Daniel Craig and Javier Bardem laughing on Skyfall red carpet Related articles Daniel Craig banks £39 MILLION for SPECTRE but doesn't 'give a... 
At the grand not-so-old age of 80, the actress trounced her competition, grabbing 26% of the votes in a new poll by Cineworld. 
Cineworld polled 3,000 of their Unlimited Card members, who gave Dench twice as many votes as her nearest competitor, Eva Green (on 13%). 
As the incredible M, Dench left famed beauties like Halle Berry, Gemma Arterton and Ursual Andress in the dust. 
Watch her in action, destroying Pierce Brosnan's cocky 007 next 
Not strictly a Bond girl, Dench as M locked horns rather than lips with the swaggering spy across seven Bond films. 
From 1995's Goldeneye to 2012's Skyfall, she was the only woman who ever held (and maintained) the upper hand with Pierce Brosnan and then Daniel Craig. 
Not even Halle Berry's memorable bikini-clad entrance in 2002's Die Another Day can displace the nation's adoration of Dame Judi. 
And when she made her heartbreaking exit from the franchise at the end of Skyfall, she died in the arms of a devastated Bond, himself. SG M dies in Bond's arms in Skyfall 
How could any woman in Bond's life compete with all that? 
THE UK'S TOP TEN BOND GIRLS: 
1. Dame Judi Dench as M: 26% 
2. Eva Green as Vesper Lynd in Casino Royale: 13% 
3. Halle Berry as Jinx in Die Another Day: 10% 
4. Gemma Arterton as Strawberry Fields in Quantum of Solace: 10% 
5. Naomie Harris as Moneypenny in Skyfall: 8% 
6. Honor Blackman as Pussy Galore in Goldfinger: 5% 
7. Rosamund Pike as Miranda Frost in Die Another Day: 4% 
8. Ursula Andress as Honey Ryder in Dr No: 4% 
9. Denise Richards at Dr Christmas Jones in The World Is Not Enough: 3% 
10. Jane Seymour as Solitaire in Live and Let Die: 2% 
SCROLL DOWN FOR THE THE UK'S FAVOURITE BOND ACTOR AND BOND VILLAIN 
As for the main man himself, there was only one real contender. 
Daniel Craig says that he never wants to play Bond again , but the nation clearly isn't ready to let him go. 
The current incumbent in the role romped home in the poll with a whopping 48% of the vote. 
Fellow tough-guy Sean Connery showed his lasting appeal in second with 23%, followed by sleek Pierce Brosnan on 18%. 
Roger Moore limped behind on 7% with Timothy Dalton on 3% and poor George Lazenby scraping 1%. 
WHO IS YOUR FAVOURITE JAMES BOND? TAKE OUR POLL NEXT: 
As for bad guys, it's all about the gnashers, it seems. 
Richard Kiel's unforgettable Jaws appeared in two films, The Spy Who Loved Me and Moonraker, and has chomped his way into the nation's hearts with 16% of the vote. 
Javier's Barem's stunning turn as Raoul Silva in Sykfall earned him a strong second place with 15%, followed by Mads Mikkelsen as Le Chiffre in Casino Royale on 12%. 
It also pays to have a gimmick,and there is an honourable mention for Harold Sakata's Oddjob and his metal-rimmed bowler hat from Goldfinger on 6%. 
THE UK'S TOP 10 BOND VILLAINS 
1. Richard Kiel as Jaws in The Spy Who Loved Me and Moonraker: 16% 
2. Javier Barden as Raoul Silva in Skyfall: 15% 
3. Mads Mikkelsen as Le Chiffre in Casino Royale: 12% 
4. Various actors, including Donald Pleasance and Telly Savalas as Ernst Blofeld (in seven Bond movies including You Only Live Twice and On Her Majesty's Secret Service): 10% 
5. Sean Bean as Alex Trevelyan in Goldeneye: 9% 
6. Harold Sakata as Oddjob in Goldfinger: 6% 
7. Robert Carlyle as Renard in The World is Not Enough: 5% 
8. Gert Frobe as Auric Goldfinger in Goldfinger: 4% 
9. Christopher Walken as Max Zorin in A View to a Kill: 4% 
10. Grace Jones as May Day in A View to a Kill: 3% 
The Cineworld poll also revealed that SPECTRE is the film we’re most looking forward to over the next few months (77%). 
UK audiences showed patritric fervour as they placed our homegrown hero above the much-hyped Star Wars: Episode VII – The Force Awakens on 66%. 
SPECTRE is out in UK cinemas on October 26. 
To book tickets for SPECTRE and to find out more about Cineworld’s Unlimited Card please visit www.cineworld.com. Related articles
